website_summaries.verdict: A host of small refinements cements the Surface Pro 4's position as the best-in-class Windows tablet -- so long as you're prepared to pay extra for the required keyboard cover accessory.
pros: The Surface Pro 4 fits a larger screen with a higher resolution into a slightly slimmer body than last year's model
The pen and keyboard cover are also improved, and this is one of the first mobile systems shipping with Intel's latest processors
cons: Microsoft still refuses to include the Type Cover keyboard by default, forcing a separate purchase
Battery life still isn't enough for a full day

If you google it, you'll see that I'm not the only one experiencing this problem, but Microsoft doesn't seem to be addressing it. I keep the firmware up to date but the bugs are not improved and Microsoft's costumer service weren't able to help (nor did they impress me as very professional).

customer_reviews.title: Do not make the mistake of purchasing this
customer_reviews.text: In all my years of working in IT, I have never had a computer blue screen on me straight out of the box. But it happened with the Surface Pro. This thing blue screened on me twice before i even got to enter a username. After somehow managing to set up a local account, the display drivers made the screen virtually unusable. I was not even able to get into settings to update the drivers as the screen did not respond to where i was touching as well as glitching out and not letting me see what screen i was on. I had high hopes for Microsoft, but unfortunately, i am left utterly disappointed

customer_reviews.text: Fantastic device, rivals Apple for build quality and ease of use. While not an iPad replacement, this is great for a laptop/work tablet. Note, because I did not realize: This does not come with the pen or the type cover. I knew it did not include the type cover but I thought it did come with the pen.
